input_text:
Job Title: Operations Initiatives Project Manager

Location: Frisco, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Business Development, Project Management

Description:
The Operations Initiative Project Manager will identify, create, and deliver best practice processes throughout DSD. This position will lead high impact projects across KDP operations.This is a highly visible role with significant exposure to senior leadership on a regular basis. Ideal candidates will have demonstrated leadership skills, held various business roles, think strategically across a broad range of topics, and be motivated to drive change.



This position's preferred location is Frisco, T

X 

POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES: Lead key special projects for KDP’s System and network optimizations teams heavily focusing on building startups and expansionCollaborate with champions, including the Senior Vice President, to deliver projects on time and on budgetDevelop and Maintain Relationships – within the Operations Initiatives team and throughout KDP networkManagers success will come from people and process; developing and maintain the right relationships and using a collaborative approach will ensure overall successCoordinate internal and external resources to ensure that projects adhere to scope, schedule, and budgetAnalyze project status and, when necessary, revise the scope, schedule, or budget to ensure that project requirements can be metProvide consistent communication on project status and changesDrive Culture Change – Drive fact-based decision making throughout the organizationWill need to utilize system skills (data pull and analysis) frequentlyAbility to travel a MINIMUM of 50% within the US and North America is an expectation of this jobAlthough this position is to primarily focus on new building start-ups plus existing building expansions and improvements, other critical DSD projects may be assigned as ne
eded
Ability to Successfully Demonstrate the Following Performance Competencies: AdaptabilityLeadership ImpactChange ManagementInnovative and Transformative ThinkerEffective CommunicatorTenacity in The Face of ResistanceStrategic Decision MakerAbility to influence at all levels of the organiz
ation
Total Rewards: Benefits, subject to election and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Paid Time Off (includingpaid parental leave, vacation, and sick time), 401k with company match, Tuition Reimbursement, and Mileage ReimbursementAnnual bonus based on performance and eligi
bility
Requirements: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university preferred (Relative Project Management Experience and/or Project Certifications may be considered for qualifications)Strong project management experience in cross functional environmentsAbility to travel for a full week at a time and up to 50% as needed for a projectAbility to effectively use Microsoft office suite of tools (heavy emphasis on EXCEL and Power Point)Ability to work full days on a shop floor or field sales-based environment. Frequent standing, sitting, climbing of stairs may be required depending on project ass
ignment

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Operations Initiatives Project Manager
output_json.summary: Lead key special projects for KDP’s System and network optimizations teams, focusing on building startups and expansion.
soft_skills: Tenacity in The Face of Resistance
job_responsibilities: Lead key special projects for KDP’s System and network optimizations teams
Focus on building startups and expansion
Collaborate with champions to deliver projects on time and on budget
Develop and maintain relationships within the Operations Initiatives team and throughout KDP network
Coordinate internal and external resources to ensure adherence to scope, schedule, and budget
Analyze project status and revise scope, schedule, or budget as necessary
Ensure consistent communication on project status and changes
Drive culture change and fact-based decision making throughout the organization
Travel a minimum of 50% within the US and North America
output_json.physical_requirements: Frequent standing, sitting, climbing of stairs
